alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Grant; Jackson; Lincoln; Natchitoches; Ouachita; Winn (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 5:35PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Grant, Jackson, eastern Natchitoches, southwestern Ouachita, southeastern Bienville, southeastern Lincoln and Winn Parishes through 630 PM CST... At 535 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Jonesboro to 8 miles north of Hutton. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ruston, Grambling, Winnfield, Jonesboro, Montgomery, Choudrant, Simsboro, Chatham, Hodge, Dry Prong, Goldonna, North Hodge, Dodson, East Hodge, Calvin, Quitman, Atlanta, Eros, Sikes and Cloutierville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CST for north central and northwestern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Bienville; Grant; Jackson; Lincoln; Natchitoches; Ouachita; Winn
